attributes.action: 2week national holiday in celebration of beating covid19 and to thank keyworkers
attributes.additional_details: To allow and understand the sacrifice the British people have given up (the biggest in pre war history) as this will most likely run through the summer. This national holiday would allow people to celebrate the sacrifice of many people and allow the key works some much need time off to see how thankful the British public are from them risking there life and to remember those who were sadly unable to beat covid-19.
attributes.background: I would like for there to be a 2 week national holiday( I understand that this may be to long and am in greateful for any holiday.) This 2 week national celebration would be for beating covid-19 as nation and thanking all the  keyworkers that put there lifes on the line to keep the country moving.

rejection.details:
We have published the following petitions, which you might like to sign:

Move all bank holidays to a time after Coronavirus Lockdown: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/309243

Bank holiday to thank those who helped during the COVID-19 crisis: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/307364

Create a new Bank Holiday in recognition of the NHS and all its amazing workers: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/303882

Introduce a 'one off' bank holiday after covid-19 pandemic to boost morale: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/304513

You can find out more about coronavirus and how you can protect yourself and others here:

www.gov.uk/coronavirus
https://www.nhs.uk/conditions/coronavirus-covid-19/

The Government has also created an online service to help you out what you can do if you’re struggling because of coronavirus: https://www.gov.uk/find-coronavirus-support

You can read NHS tips to help if you are worried about coronavirus here: https://www.nhs.uk/oneyou/every-mind-matters/coronavirus-covid-19-anxiety-tips

You can read impartial analysis of the Government response to coronavirus and policy developments here: https://commonslibrary.parliament.uk/coronavirus/

You may also be interested to know that because of the large number of petitions that have been started in relation to coronavirus, the Petitions Committee has been questioning the Government about its response to the coronavirus outbreak.
